pr_title: Retrieve constant dynamic info from the JITClient

timeline.message:
Retrieve constant dynamic info from the JITClient

Dynamic constant is not stored at the JITServer. It needs
to be retrieved from the client side. It will fix the server
crash when running Java 11 sanity test `CondyPrimitive_1`.

Related to #7567

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

Dynamic constant is not stored at the `JITServer`. It needs
to be retrieved from the client side. It will fix the server

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

Retrieve constant dynamic info from the JITClient

Dynamic constant is not stored at the JITServer.
The server will send one message to retrieve both the pointer
and the object values in `TR_ResolvedJ9JITServerMethod::dynamicConstant()`.
It has dependency on the new `dynamicConstant` API
defined in eclipse/omr#4726.
This commit fixes the server crash when running
Java 11 sanity test `CondyPrimitive_1`.

Related to #7567

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: Maybe have an assert saying that we must have VM access when calling this API
timeline.author: mpirvu

replies.bodyText: The assert check will fail with J9::SymbolReferenceTable::findOrCreateConstantDynamicSymbol() which doesn't acquire VM access before calling dynamicConstant(). It doesn't dereference the pointer.
replies.author: a7ehuo

timeline.bodyText: Maybe just describe what the function does without a mention to JITServer
timeline.author: mpirvu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -397,10 +397,16 @@ class TR_ResolvedJ9Method : public TR_J9Method, public TR_ResolvedJ9MethodBase
     *  \param cpIndex
     *     The constant pool index of the constant dynamic.
     *
+    *  \param obj
+    *     Return the resolved constant dynamic value.
+    *
     *  \return
     *     Opaque pointer to the slot containing the resolved constant dynamic value.
+    *     In the JITServer mode, the returned pointer should always be dereferenced

timeline.bodyText: I think you can make this a reference
timeline.author: mpirvu

timeline.bodyText: Inside there is an object dereference which needs to be protected with VM access, just like the non-jitserver code does.
timeline.author: mpirvu

timeline.bodyText: Below, when doing loadConstant(TR::iconst, *(int32_t*)(obj+valueOffset)); we can run into trouble for JITServer. Maybe that tryToAcquireVMAccess is implemented such that it always fails on JITServer
timeline.author: mpirvu

timeline.message:
Retrieve constant dynamic info from the JITClient

Dynamic constant is not stored at the JITServer.
The server will send one message to retrieve both the pointer
and the object values in `TR_ResolvedJ9JITServerMethod::dynamicConstant()`.
It has dependency on the new `dynamicConstant` API
defined in eclipse/omr#4726.
This commit fixes the server crash when running
Java 11 sanity test `CondyPrimitive_1`.

Related to #7567

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

Retrieve constant dynamic info from the JITClient

Dynamic constant is not stored at the JITServer.
The server will send one message to retrieve both the pointer
and the object values in `TR_ResolvedJ9JITServerMethod::dynamicConstant()`.
It has dependency on the new `dynamicConstant` API
defined in eclipse/omr#4726.
This commit fixes the server crash when running
Java 11 sanity test `CondyPrimitive_1`.

Related to #7567

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText:
This is a change in behavior; previously the compilation thread acquired VM access and potentially waited to do so. With the new code the compilation thread attempts to acquire VM access, but if it cannot get it right away, it bails out.
I would like some confirmation from the optimizer team that this new behavior is ok (may have performance implications) and that there is a safe path if we don't wait for VM access.
timeline.author: mpirvu

replies.bodyText: Shouldn't change it to tryToAcquireVMAccess since we're not dereferencing the obj. Will update the code.
replies.author: a7ehuo

timeline.author: mpirvu

replies.bodyText: The existing code in TR_J9VMBase::tryToAcquireAccess() does what's required at the server. The new code is not needed. Will be removed.
replies.author: a7ehuo

timeline.message:
Retrieve constant dynamic info from the JITClient

[skip ci]
Dynamic constant is not stored at the JITServer.
The server will send one message to retrieve both the pointer
and the object values in `TR_ResolvedJ9JITServerMethod::dynamicConstant()`.
It has dependency on the new `dynamicConstant` API
defined in eclipse/omr#4726.
This commit fixes the server crash when running
Java 11 sanity test `CondyPrimitive_1`.

Related to #7567

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

Retrieve constant dynamic info from the JITClient

[skip ci]
Dynamic constant is not stored at the JITServer.
The server will send one message to retrieve both the pointer
and the object values in `TR_ResolvedJ9JITServerMethod::dynamicConstant()`.
It has dependency on the new `dynamicConstant` API
defined in eclipse/omr#4726. Also increased the JITServer `MINOR_NUMBER`
to `2`.
This commit fixes the server crash when running
Java 11 sanity test `CondyPrimitive_1`.

Related to #7567

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

Retrieve constant dynamic info from the JITClient

[skip ci]
Dynamic constant is not stored at the JITServer.
The server will send one message to retrieve both the pointer
and the object values in `TR_ResolvedJ9JITServerMethod::dynamicConstant()`.
It has dependency on the new `dynamicConstant` API
defined in eclipse/omr#4726.

Also increased the JITServer `MINOR_NUMBER` to `2` since
the new message types have to be handled at the client as well.

This commit fixes the server crash when running
Java 11 sanity test `CondyPrimitive_1`.

Related to #7567

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

Dynamic constant is not stored at the JITServer.
The server will send one message to retrieve both the pointer
and the object values in `TR_ResolvedJ9JITServerMethod::dynamicConstant()`.
It has dependency on the new `dynamicConstant` API
defined in eclipse/omr#4726.

Also increased the JITServer `MINOR_NUMBER` to `3` since
the new message types have to be handled at the client as well.

This commit fixes the server crash when running
Java 11 sanity test `CondyPrimitive_1`.

Related to #7567
